intro: Leandra raddii, commonly known as the red leandra, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Styracaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and thrives in well-drained, acidic soil. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. Leandra raddii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate partial shade.
